name: Courtyard by Marriott Baltimore Downtown / Inner Harbor

reviews.text: As a fairly frequent visitor to Baltimore (known as Fenway South) during Red Sox vs Orioles games; this location and Courtyard was a great find! I had stayed in inner harbor (YIKES$$$$$) times before and had decided to stay cheaper close to the airport for the weekend - but found this location days before the weekend and was psyched I did!
reviews.title: Smart Choice

likes.disliked: — They need a Red Sox Nation flag to fly outside

reviews.title: Good and bad
reviews.text: First - I'm a rewards memeber so I stay at lots of Marriotts (at all levels) and are seldom disappointed - but being a city person I know the "location" can be the "make or break"in a city - especially in Baltimore which definaitely has a "gritty" side/feel to it (not necessairly a bad thing - but a consideration for safety).

This location in Harbor East was excellent. We (two females) felt perfectly safe walking in area both to and from Inner Harbor, and Fells Point in both day and night. We walked and took the water taxi ($8.00 for the day - great value and just two blocks to this hotel from the landing). I really liked that on this side of the harbor you had both the conveience of walking to all inner harbor has, and in the other direction (about four blocks) you were in Fells Point with all it's shops, restaurants, local Foodie Market (like Lexington Market in Philly and so many other cities) and bars (local and touristy) galore. We ate a "Angie's" in the open market (local counter service and you can't beat a great down home lunch for most under $5.00!) Note: there are also two water taxi stops in the Fells Point Area (from inner harbor) so you have that option too and then you can easlity walk back to hotel.
reviews.title: Really surprised at the quaity

reviews.text: The hotel itself is new, clean, spacious. Restaurant on site for breakfast buffett (not complimentary) - we didn't partake - not with great local breakfast joints so close - but buffet looked pretty good. Service was pleasant (and it was a very busy weekend) and responsive. All the usual amenities of a Coutyard and even more so - several computer to use free of charge, had a small bar and nice sit down areas with flat acreen TV's, couches, tables etc. One late night after game we got take-out from a inner harbor restaurant - took the water taxi back and ate in this "living room" area (not to stink up the room) - it was great. Others were having wine and beers another section watching TV. Nice touch.
reviews.title: Great for family getaway weekend
Exceeded expectations. Bonus: Whole Foods in building.
reviews.text: The best thing though for this "inner harbor" convenience and to be so close to Fells Point and Little Italy area (which is just another few blocks north of the hotel (save that for next time!) was that the cost was extremely reasonable ($179.00 AAA rate for Sat). All other hotels in the inner harbor (and the Marriott Inner Harbor which is a block next to this Courtyard) were in the $300-$500 range. To stay at the airport (Springhill Suites I had booked was $139.00) and to have to take the light rail to and from this inner harbor area for the difference of approx $40.00 was a no-brainer! You were right in local inner harbor area - great deal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and the Mrs. thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Courtyard Baltimore. We were in town for the Antiques Roadshow that was in town for the day. The hotel is in a rapidly expanding area just slighty off the Inner Harbor in Little Italy section of Baltimore. There is alot of contstruction of luxury condos so the area is in a state of flux. One of the big plusses is that the hotels share the same building as a Whole Foods Market where if you dont want to go out to eat and just want to chill in the room you can pick something up and take to your room.
reviews.title: Loved the Courtyard

reviews.text: The hotel staff was friendly and answered any questions we had with courtesy and a smile (this should be a given for hotels but unfortunately it is not so). The room was very clean and the bed was just right. Parking is $13.25 per day (if you dont use your car) but if you plan to drive around during your stay you can have your parking ticked validated by the hotel staff and you can have unlimited acess in or out for $19 per day.
reviews.title: Very Nice One-Night Stay

likes.disliked: — Room too quiet; could hear people cough in adjoining room, but that's all.

reviews.title: Attention to Detail
reviews.text: There is an abundance of restaurants in the area for all types of food. We enjoyed Mo's Crab and Pasta for lunch and Della Notte for Sunday brunch (it is pricey but the food is exellent and you get live jazz while you eat).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a 10 min walk to the Harbor and shopping so that isnt overwhelming especially on a nice breezy summer day. I definately recommend this location for a stay in Charm City.
reviews.title: A good option in Baltimore

reviews.text: I first used their building because I had a business obligation in one of their conference rooms... I had no intentions of staying overnight. While seeing the staff throughout the evening several times, they treated me as though I was a customer even though I was only using their facilities...they were friendly, courteous, and seemed genuine. After having to use their lobby area for quite some time, and staying much longer than I intended, my boyfriend and I decided to inquire about their availability. It turned out they had one room available and were willing to work with us to book it for the remainder of the night. The staff member and manager were eager to give us suggestions on places to walk to and see for the night.
reviews.title: Staff = super friendly and accommodating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After my stay, I realized I had forgotten the receipt (among other items needed for a business expense) and once again, the manager proved to be friendly, accommodating, and understanding. I will definitely go back to this hotel because of the staff, the convenient location, ease of parking, and cleanly rooms.
reviews.title: The good, the really not so bad and NO UGLY........

reviews.text: My husband and I chose this Marriott in Baltimore because we were able to get 2 free nights with our rewards points. The biggest "good" about this Marriott is the LOCATION. We walked everywhere from this central spot. And there are such great restaurants in the immediate area as well. The 2 young women at the front desk who checked us in were friendly and welcoming the whole time we were there. The room was simply a hotel room......king size bed, TV, bathroom, small desk and small couch. I will say the shower had great water pressure.......I don't know why but I was very pleasantly surprised by that! We did pay to park in the garage attached to the hotel and then never, ever moved the car until the day we left to come home. One small disappointment was the quality of the towels (very thin). We would definitely stay here again. We just loved the location and we were told they will be doing some updating......can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Could be better
Desperately needs a makeover
reviews.text: I stayed here for four days, and fell in love with the location more than the actual hotel. I upgraded to a suite but the room was still very hard and "business motel" in its feel. The pass to the full spa/gym is great, and there are many restaurant and entertainment options that you can walk to in Harbor East.
Some of the channels on my TV did not work, and it was never fixed. The manager gave me half off my final night due to the inconvenience. The front desk staff was kind and helpful.
reviews.title: Good location but not worth the price

reviews.text: For the second year in a row, I held a two-day conference at the Courtyard by Marriott Baltimore Downtown/Inner Harbor. The meeting space was ideal - two session rooms, a hallway wide enough to accommodate breakfast and lunch set-up, restrooms right in the same area. Room rates were affordable for entrepreneurs. Most important, the staff and service were FANTASTIC! Pleasant, responsive, helpful and professional. It was a pleasure to be there.
reviews.title: Great experience at Courtyard by Marriott Baltimore Downtown/Inner Harbor

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights for a wedding. We had a great room and it was clean and comfortable. We were welcomed at the front desk by a very friendly guest representative. We had another room reserved for the 2nd night and she made sure it was close to us.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent, friendly staff

reviews.text: The wedding was at the Four Seasons which was a block away. It was convenient for us to walk over there. We had plenty of places to eat nearby. There is a Whole Foods very close which was convenient.
reviews.title: Expensive for what it is...

reviews.text: This is a very well maintained and well staffed hotel. I would not hesitate to stay here in the future.
reviews.title: Functional

reviews.text: I stayed here for a weekend. The weekend I was there the rate was almost double the normal Courtyard rate and there was really nothing special about this particular one. In fact, it felt kind of old. Perhaps the rates go up and down here in function of NFL and MLB games and I just chose the wrong weekend.
reviews.title: Great stay for a business trip

reviews.text: The hotel is just like most other Courtyard's, clean, confortable with a very friendly and professional staff. The hotel is under renovation, but it did not conflict with our stay. We have stayed at this Courtyard before and we probably had a better rate this time because of the renovations. The location is ideal, close to attractions and restaurants and in a safe area.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: This hotel was the worst of our recent trips. The hotel is clean enough but the staff is strangely unhelpful. The woman at the front desk continued eating her sandwich in front of us barely pausing to answer a question, which she didn't have the answer to any way. I understand a lack of service occasionaly - it happens - but must they be rude to you?
reviews.title: Excellent location, Mediocre Hotel

reviews.text: They didn't have any good suggestions for local restaurants beyond the tourist fare nearby.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean, and close to major sites

reviews.text: If you are looking for a quick stay in a tourist area then this is sufficient. If you are looking for better, I would look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Good location between Inner Harbor and Fells Point

reviews.text: As you'd expect from a Courtyard, this hotel is not fancy but the rooms were comfortable and clean. When we stayed here, the lobby and some other areas were under renovation, but it didn't interfere with our stay in any way. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Fells Point and Inner Harbor sites are within walking distance, but there is also a stop just down the block for the free bus called the Charm City Circulator (worth checking out - it goes to major sites and there's no charge). As for amenities, this Courtyard is in a shopping area (stores and a couple restaurants), with a grocery store (Whole Foods) just next door. In my opinion, this hotel provides a good value if you want to be very near the Inner Harbor.
reviews.title: Convenient location

reviews.text: We checked in here for a family celebration away from home and had a great stay. Check in was flawless, staff efficient and helpfull. We enjoyed the room and the city view from a high floor. In Baltimore you can see a long way from vertually any tall building since there are so few...tall buildings to block the view. The pool was a bit of a let down as it was cold. The hot tub was the savior of this area even though we were scolded for dangling our legs off the side by the young guard. The fitness center ...needs serious updating. Equipment is worn and the room is tiny. I understand that the hotel is getting a face lift and I hope the fitness room gets attention. The best thing to do would be to open up the wall between it and the pool area with glass partiitons. it would have a dramatic effect. The breakfast buffet was incredible with lots of fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, breads, bagels then several kinds of breakfast meats, eggs cooked to order, fresh made waffles. I can't imagine someone not being able to find something they like to eat. The service was efficient and polite. There are plenty of dining choices in the neighborhood. Park your car and forget about driving. Heat the pool and I will be back soon.
reviews.title: Freindly front desk, nice room, so so pool and fitness center

reviews.text: A block from the harbor, near lots of shops and the like. Self parking only, which makes parking a tad cheaper at 23 bucks a night. Amenities lacking compared to other Marriots in the area. For that reason I felt the price was a little high. Its an older building as well, but quiet and clean.
reviews.title: Good Location, Pricey for lack of Amenities

reviews.text: Stayed here off of Marriott points for a friend's birthday. i travel frequently to Baltimore for work and usually stay at the Marriott Waterfront or Renaissance Harborplace, but they were both sold out. The Courtyard was good, but not great. It is not as big or update as the other hotels in the area, but is a good value for the price. Rooms were spacious and the front desk was nice. There was an issue at first that our room did not have a roll away as requested, so they moved us to a bigger room that would accommodate a roll away bed.
reviews.title: Nice, but not the best in Downtown Baltimore
Great location
reviews.text: We tend to stay at marriotts where ever possible. This hotel is in a great location that was close to everything, shops, restaurants and the inner harbor. The staff was wonderful, helpful and very friendly . The rooms were clean and nice but I have I have to say the hotel could use a bit of an upgrade.

This is my 5th time staying 2 weeks at a time. Every part of this hotel has great people, Milinda with her sweet good morning remembering my name, Ricardo getting the type of room needed, Tiffany with determination to get me a taxi to handle my scooter. Joaquin, & Angel very helpful valets, Faye and Sam at Breakfast bar helping with all my needs, Bessie for room service always leaving what extra things we need. Wish I could remember all the names of very special staff that makes this a true come home hotel.
reviews.title: Another 2 week stay

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Baltimore Downtown / Inner Harbor Hotel
description: The new state-of-the-art lobby at Courtyard Baltimore Downtown/Inner Harbor provides greater flexibility and choices for our guests. This Inner Harbor hotel features our new lobby with inviting, flexible spaces to work or relax in, free Wi-Fi throughout and easy access to the latest news, weather and airport conditions via our GoBoard™. The highlight of our new lobby experience is The Bistro - Eat. Drink. Connect.™which provides guests with healthy food and beverage offerings in the morning and evening dinner service with cocktails. This hotel near downtown Baltimore is also conveniently located near the National Aquarium and one and a half miles from the Baltimore Convention Center. We offer a well-equipped fitness center, indoor pool and whirlpool. A 24-hour business center and boarding pass printing service is also available. Your stay at Courtyard Baltimore Downtown/Inner Harbor is sure to be more comfortable, more productive and more enjoyable than ever before!
